intro: Phylloschoenus acutiflorus, commonly known as the sharp-flowered phylloschoenus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its distinctive, acute floral structures. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
